messages.subject: For all you music geeks
messages.msgSnippet: Kelly, My dh is a drummer, I could have him email ya! But music for drums is simply rhythm tablature. All the notes are on the same line, because there
messages.messageBody:
Kelly,
My dh is a drummer, I could have him email ya!
But "music" for drums is simply rhythm tablature. All the "notes" are on the
same line, because there aren't really notes (unless you're playing steel
drums).
I have NO idea how you tell which drum in the set you're supposed to be
playing on as my percussion experience extends only to triangle and cymbals.
But I know there is a method by which each drum is notated.
He has to learn whole notes, half notes, fourths ,eighths etc.....
If you want to talk to Mark his email is Bleuthunderstar@....

Ren
"The answers aren't important really...
What's important, is knowing all the questions."
-Zilpha Keatley Snyder
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
